issue.title: Useless indexing
issue.body: coala filters the ignored files after indexing all the files, which can take a long time with globs such as **. Build tools like Tox create temporary folders with multitude of files, and coala on every run will index them first and then filter them out. In a small project the indexing and filtering can take about 75% of the execution time (80 seconds). This should be fixed by filtering during the process of indexing.

issue.title: Travis CI Sentinel build failing due to new version of pytest-xdist installed
issue.body:
Overview Description
Steps to Reproduce

Clone the coala repository
Install test-requirements.txt
Figure out which version of pytest-xdist is installed. It must be v1.28.0 but v1.15.0 should be installed acc. to requirements.
Run pytest on coala to get the error log

Actual Results
Travis CI Sentinel build error log
Reproducibility
100%
Additional Info
7 days back only pytest-xdist has released its new version v1.28.0
which is getting installed and has requirements of pytest>4.4.0

issue.title: coala -A throws exception on EOF signal
issue.body:
Overview Description
Sending EOF signal to coala -A results in EOFError
Steps to Reproduce

run coala with -A or --single-action flag
press Ctrl-D(EOF signal)
EOFError is dumped to the console

Actual Results
EOFError is dumped on console with the following traceback
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/bin/coala", line 11, in <module>
    load_entry_point('coala', 'console_scripts', 'coala')()
  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala.py", line 121, in main
    return mode_normal(console_printer, None, args, debug=debug)
  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala_modes.py", line 29, in mode_normal
    debug=debug)
  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala_main.py", line 116, in run_coala
    choice = input(line)
EOFError

Expected Results
A better message like, Found EOF. Exiting gracefully. should be shown and the process must exit with status code 0
Reproducibility
100%
Additional Information:
difficulty/low
coala/main

issue.title: Setting.py: Change property name
issue.body:
The line_number property for Setting class should be changed to start_line_number as it is the starting line number of a setting.
difficulty/newcomer

issue.title: Report debug messages during glob expansion
issue.body:
coala appears to hang whenever a glob takes a long time to expand.
This happens very frequently when it descends into node_modules/ .  There are other bugs about coala behaving better when descending a node_modules/, but typically nobody wants it to descend node_modules/, so this should be an error.
There should be regular debug messages during a glob expansion, including when they appear in files = .. and ignore = ...

issue.title: Modify `Linter` module for aspects
issue.body: Linter module needs to be modified so that the Result object makes use of aspects. It can be made similar to the implementation in the Result module plus more features can be added to make it even more usable.

issue.title: Make `--files` optional (useful when only GitCommitBear is used)
issue.body:
If I only want to run GitCommitBear, why bother adding files which GitCommitBear doesn't use at all?
Currently, running coala --bears GitCommitBear returns
[WARNING][15:34:52] coala will not run any analysis. Did you forget to give the `--files` argument?

issue.title: Add Jekyll Liquid language
issue.body:
We use Liquid language in Jekyll sites.
We should have a language definition for it.

issue.title: Invalid link to GitHub on coala API Documentation
issue.body:
coala uses Read the Docs to generate API webpages. However, there is a floating window at the bottom right corner which displays a link to corresponding GitHub page.
For example, on the page coalib package, you can click on the small floating window at the bottom right corner and it would display a window as follows:

The view link points to https://github.com/coala/coala/blob/master/docs/coalib.rst, which doesn't exist.

issue.title: Remove implementation of SpaceConsistencyTestBear
issue.body:
SpaceConsistencyTestBear contains an old algorithm of the SpaceConsistencyBear.
And there are five tests which depend on the output of its algorithm.
When the run method is replaced with pass, these tests fail:
FAIL tests/coalaCITest.py::coalaCITest::test_limit_files_affirmative
FAIL tests/coalaCITest.py::coalaCITest::test_show_patch
FAIL tests/coalaCITest.py::coalaCITest::test_show_patch_debug
FAIL tests/coalaTest.py::coalaTest::test_run_coala_no_autoapply
FAIL tests/coalaTest.py::coalaTest::test_run_coala_no_autoapply_debug

But more importantly, some unexpected parts of the codebase suddenly have no coverage.
coalib/coala_main.py                                                  104      1     48      1    99%   207, 206->207
coalib/output/ConsoleInteraction.py                                   337      1    156      1    99%   296, 287->296
coalib/results/result_actions/ShowPatchAction.py                       72      2     28      1    97%   104-107, 103->104

That means those lines of code are being indirectly tested by the inner workings of the bear.
These lines of code all need specific tests which are not based on large, old and convoluted algorithm of a bear.
They should have tiny neat little bears which are very simple and do only enough to activate those lines of code, and do it directly.

issue.title: Linter.py: Make it possible to override `executable` for all linter bears
issue.body:
Say, we have a linter bear called FooLinterBear:
@linter(executable='foo', output=[...])
class FooLinterBear:
   [...]
If a user is in an environment, where they can't make the wrapped tool available as foo in the $PATH or want to use a different version than is regularly installed, they currently have no way to use the bear, since the executable is hard-coded. I discovered this, when I wanted to use PyflakesBear for a Python 2 project: Pyflakes has the same output in both versions, so the linter would work fine, if I could override the executable with the Python 2 version.
I'm imagining something like this:
[python]
bears=Pyflakesbear
override_executable=/path/to/python2/pyflakes
Obviously, this would have to be used with great care and should probably always emit a warning, since it's easy to destroy the functionality of the bear.
I'm not sure if that's something we want to add, so please add your opinions :)

issue.title: Fix EOF error
issue.body:
When running coala with -A or --single-action flag,
the program will exit 1 if user pressing Ctrl + D.
Now, the program will exit 0.
Fixes #6003

issue.title: coala_modes.py: Show language capabilities in json
issue.body:
coala provides a way to users to get to know about
capabilities of a language i.e. What can it detect
and fix. But it is output as a normal std output.
This commit adds a way to show language capabilities
in JSON format i.e. in coala-json.
Closes #2467
Checklist

 I read the commit guidelines and I've followed
them.
 I ran coala over my code locally.

issue.title: Linter.py: Add support for aspects
issue.body:
This commit modifies Linter module
for aspects usage. The linter results
will be analysed and if a valid leaf
aspect is found it will be set for that
result.
Closes #5694

comments.bodyText: Ctrl-Z-Enter would look like we need to press all the 3 keys simultaneously. But iirc, The proper way to send an EOF signal in Windows is to press Ctrl-Z followed by Enter. So something like, Ctrl-Z followed by Enter would seem more appropriate.
comments.diffHunk:
@@ -31,7 +31,7 @@ def do_nothing(*args):
 
 
 STR_ENTER_LETTER = 'Enter letter (Ctrl-{} to exit): '.format(
-    'Z' if platform.system() == 'Windows' else 'D')
+    'Z-Enter' if platform.system() == 'Windows' else 'D')
